fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are unable to import Word Documents to be used as Confluence Pages in their instance
h3. Environment
 * 1000.383.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence or go to an existing page (you want to view the page, not edit it).
 # Choose !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/704577869/ellipsis.png?version=1&modificationDate=1422393340385&api=v2! > *Import Word Document*
 # Choose *Browse* and locate the Word document you want to import then choose *Next*.
 The import document options appear.
 # Enter a *title* for the new page
 # Choose *where* you want to import the file - used _Import as a new page in the current space_
 # Choose how to handle *title conflicts* - used _Rename imported pages if page name already exists_
 # Choose whether to create a single page or multiple pages based on the heading styles in the file (this option is only available if the file contains heading styles). - _N/A as example document did not contain heading styles_ (verified for other customer where the import fails if you choose split based on headings)
 # Click *Import*.

h3. Expected Results

Page is imported successfully
h3. Actual Results

NPE is generated and displayed on page:
{noformat}
Cause

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.benryan.webwork.WordImportAction.resolveTitleConflicts(WordImportAction.java:661)
h3. Notes
{noformat}
It appears if the Word Document is attached and the Office Word Macro is utilized, the document can be displayed
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Unable to Import large Word Document to Confluence

fields.description:
Bug Template

h3. Summary
- Unable to remove/add Page Restrictions to a page.

h3. Environment
- Cloud - Confluence 1000.878.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a page that contains child pages.
# Try to remove or add page restrictions
# Noticed that the page will hang after applying the changes and will display an error "There was an error submitting the page restrictions". 

h3. Expected Results
- Page restrictions should successfully take place

h3. Actual Results
It fails with error "There was an error submitting the page restrictions". 

# Browser Console is showing
{noformat}
Request URL:https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/setcontentpermissions.action?viewPermissionsUsers=ff80808150cfe7500150d3304857002d%2Cff80808150cfe7500150d32fc6e20017%2Cff80808143894f2d0143909834d0001d%2Cff80808143894f2d01439098542c0033%2Cff80808143894f2d014390985b510038%2Cff80808143894f2d0143909863e5003e%2Cff8080814376cdb5014376d014c30003%2Cff80808150cfe7500150d32fc6370016&editPermissionsUsers=ff80808150cfe7500150d32fc6e20017%2Cff80808143894f2d0143909834d0001d%2Cff80808143894f2d01439098542c0033%2Cff80808143894f2d014390985b510038%2Cff80808143894f2d0143909863e5003e%2Cff8080814376cdb5014376d014c30003%2Cff80808150cfe7500150d32fc6370016&viewPermissionsGroups=&editPermissionsGroups=&contentId=45024784&atl_token=d6c350d8088c68aec9cd72718dd843acdbfbde40&_=1484830665792
Request Method:GET
Status Code:504 Gateway Time-out
Remote Address:104.192.136.193:443
{noformat}

h3. Workaround 

Apply restrictions to child pages instead of the top of the page tree. If a child has a lot of further child pages, you'll need to dig deeper down the chain until it works.

Alternatively, job will finish on it's own. Leave the page open for a while (how long depends on the amount of content), and navigate back to page. Restrictions will eventually be applied.
fields.summary: Unable to remove/add Page Restrictions to a Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a group which contains a single quote in its name, the *Save* button in space permissions become unclickable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to edit a space permissions
# Add a group which names contains a single quote.
# Click on *Save*

h3. Expected Results
Modifications made to space permissions are saved.

h3. Actual Results
The *Save* button stays greyed out and cannot be clicked anymore. The changes are not taken into account.

h3.Workaround
You can save the modifications by adding a new group to the space permissions after you made your modifications. Once the dummy group is added, click on *Save* which will disable the button, then click on *Cancel*. The page will refresh and your modifications will be taken into account. You can then remove the dummy group from the space permissions without any issues.
fields.summary: Unable to save change to space permissions when adding a group with a quote in it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching for attachments via the search bar, deleted attachments that were not purged will still show up in the search results.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.444.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete an attachment from a page.
# Search for the attachment name in the search bar.

h3. Expected Results
The deleted attachment does not show up in the results.

h3. Actual Results
Deleted attachment shows up in the search results.
 
h3.Workaround
After clearing the trash, the deleted attachments do not show up anymore in the search results.
fields.summary: Deleted attachments are still showing up in the search results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When embedding Google Documents in Confluence, even that the same is public Confluence will prompt users to authenticate.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have a Google document on the drive (https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/my-drive)
# Make sure to have the [Google Drive add-on for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence-google-drive/cloud/overview] installed
# On the Google side, either have the document *Public on the Web* (Anyone on the internet can find and access) or *Anyone with the Link* link sharing configured
 # Try to have access without using a Google account or any Confluence account

h3. Expected Results

Be able to view the document as an anonymous user or without any kind of authentication

h3. Actual Results

Confluence will prompt user to authenticate in a Google account in order to see the document
  

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Confluence will prompt users to authenticate even when the Google document is public

fields.description:
Adding a JIRA issue macro within a multiexcerpt macro will not create the reciprocal link on JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a multiexcerpt macro.
# Add a JIRA Issue macro withing the multiexcerpt.

h3. Expected Results

The page link is created on the JIRA issue.

h3. Actual Results

No link is created. 

h3. Notes

The JIRA issue will be visible on Confluence, but the real link won't exist.
h3.Workaround

Go to the JIRA Issue and manually link the Confluence page.
fields.summary: JIRA Macro within multiexcerpt macro won't create a reciprocal link.

fields.description: When using the content API to render content on the client-side, it is a requirement to load the webresource dependencies for stylesheets in order for the content to look correct (i.e. - not have missing styles). I haven't been able to find any way to do this without causing a "flash of unstyled content" while waiting for the CSS resources to finish loading. This is more prominent under poor network conditions.
fields.summary: Flash of unstyled content when using content rest API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Previously, It's possible to navigate to {{CloudURL/webdav/backupmanager}} to see which backups have already been created previously. With Filestore, that's no longer possible. This creates a few issues:
# Only the person that generated the backup are able to download the generated backup (other users will not be able to, they will need to re-generate it again)
# Another user might wish to generate the backup shortly after that, but instead, is faced with this: "Backup frequency is limited. You can not make another backup right now"
# Previously usable backup scripts are broken, especially those that automatically downloads the backups from /webdav/backupmanager (which was a much neater way of doing things)
fields.summary: With the move to Filestore, customers are unable to see which backups were created previously

Table plus macro (Bobswift add-on) can not be viewed if it located in Excerpt Macro

h3. How to replicate

# Create a *Excerpt Include macro* in the second page and include the first page in it.
# The table plus macro will not show and the error below will show:
#- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
#- {noformat}
Error contacting Confluence
Unexpected error occurred. Contact an administrator.
Error code was 404 - Not Found, accessing resource /rest/api/content/163184826/history/9/macro/id/1ef11161-1bde-43fa-9575-c42e32d9c72f.
{noformat}

h3. Expected result
The table plus content should show properly

h3. Summary
Exporting a page containing a Bob Swift advanced table results in a white page (only the title is exported).


h3. Environment
Version 1000.801.1 (it was not available to be selected in the affected versions field)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bob Swift advanced table add-on:
#* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.table/cloud/overview
# Create a page and add an advanced table to the page
# Export the page to word or pdf

h3. Expected Results
The table is exported

h3. Actual Results
The table is not exported 

h3.Workaround
No workaround available at the moment.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user watches a page, and an attachment is added to a page using the Attachments macro, there is no notification email sent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a page with Attachment macro on it
# Put a user as watcher
# With another user, put an attachment on this page using the macro

h3. Expected Results
User should receive an email notification of the new attachment

h3. Actual Results
User does not receive an email notification of the new attachment
 
h3. Notes
* If attachments are added through "..." > "Attachments", then it work.

h3. Workaround
Users can use the  "..." > "Attachments" if they want other users to be notified about it.
fields.summary: Email notifications are not sent to users that watch a page when an attachment is added using Attachment gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachments are not showing when browsing the page via IE 11.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud 
 * IE 11

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Upload a big size image to a page (i.e 1024 x 768)
 # Resize the image into medium
 !Resize.jpeg|thumbnail!
 # Save
 # View the page in IE

h3. Expected result

Image is showing.

!chrome.jpeg|thumbnail!
h3. Actual result

Image is not showing.

!IE.jpeg|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * This is not happening when resizing the image from smaller size to larger size.
 * The image is showing on Chrome and Firefox.
 * Preview image is working fine.

h3. Workaround
 # Clear browser caches and try again
 # Use Chrome/Firefox
 # Click on the image to preview it
 # Make the image into smaller size via image editor, then re-upload it.
fields.summary: Image Resize to Smaller than Original Size, Thumbnail is not Showing on IE
Español Language, Date Picker Incorrect

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to paste an image from the clipboard into a Confluence page in Internet Explorer, the attachment fails to display. 

h3. Environment
* Windows machine
* Internet Explorer 11 (note this does not occur in any other browser)
* Confluence 1000.340.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence in Internet Explorer 11 on a PC
# Take a screenshot of a page (Prnt Screen) or use the Microsoft Snipping Tool
# Navigate to a page in Confluence and initiate edit of the page
# Paste the image into the page using CTRL + V or right click and paste

h3. Expected Results
The attachment is successfully attached and can be previewed on the page. 

h3. Actual Results
The UI shows that the image is being attached, however, when the attaching process is complete, the image displays as an “X” as shown in the screenshot: 
!failed_attachment.png|thumbnail!

The file appears in the list of attachments on the page, but when trying to preview the file, it fails. 

h3.Workaround
Use Firefox or Chrome browsers to attach images in this way.
fields.summary: Paste image from clipboard fails in internet explorer

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Turn on collaborative editing
# Create a [shortcut link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Configuring+Shortcut+Links] with Insert > Link, select Advanced
# In the "Link" field type "atlassian@google", click Insert
# Save the page
# Hover over the new link, notice that it's pointing to http://www.google.com/search?q=atlassian
# Edit the page, then immediately click Update without any other changes

h3. Expected results
The link stays as-is (a Google search for "atlassian").

h3. Actual results
The link is changed to point to the same page the user is editing.

h3. Notes
This does _not_ happen when collaborative editing is turned off.
fields.summary: Shortcut links are lost upon saving when collaborative editing is on

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When updating the profile information, the details are not saved.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.304.0
* SSO is enabled

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Profile
# Edit Profile
# Save

h3. Expected Result
The fields should be updated.

h3. Actual Result
The page refreshed after "Save" button is clicked, then all data on the fields go blank. When view the profile again, the fields are not updated.

h3. Note
# This only happens for Confluence Cloud with SSO enabled.

h3.Workaround
Disable the Single Sign-on option within User Management
fields.summary: Profile Details Are Not Saved
Custom CSS no longer works in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The page refreshes when cllicking on Table Contents links instead of jumping to the right location.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud 1000.847.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have SPA enabled
 # Visit a page
 # Then visit another page with the table of contents macro on it (causing an SPA transition)
 # Click table of contents macro link

h3. Expected Results

Page doesn't refresh
h3. Actual Results

Page refreshes
h3. Workaround

Use other browsers
fields.summary: Links in the Table of Contents don't work using Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues to display the code on the Code block macro. There's no scroll bar and no ability to format.
h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence v1000.518.1 (x)
On Confluence v1000.230.0 and Confluence v1000.340.2 it works. Used lmedina.jira-dev.com and lmenezes.jira-dev.com to test. (/)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a page in confluence.
# Insert macro > Code block macro.
# insert a code or any line that has more characters than it can be shown on the screen due to resolution.

h3. Expected Results
The code block macro should be able to scroll and see all the code.
h3. Actual Results
It only shows what's in the screen not being able to scroll and see the rest of the code.
h3. Notes 
It may be related to this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-45326
h3.Workaround
Insert line breaks so the code will stretch on the vertical.
fields.summary: Code block macro not showing all the content

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a page has restrictions applied and is deleted, the page will still be listed in the *Restricted Pages* tab in the *Space Permissions*.
When the user tries to remove the restriction, they are redirected to a 404 page and the restriction is still applied.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.444.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add restrictions to a page.
# Delete the page.
# Go to *Space Tools* > *Permissions* > *Restricted Pages*

h3. Expected Results
The deleted page is not listed in *Restricted Pages*.

h3. Actual Results
The deleted page is still listed in *Restricted Pages*.

h3.Workaround
Restore the page, then remove restrictions and delete the page again. The page will no longer be listed in *Restricted Pages*.
fields.summary: Restricted pages that have been deleted are still showing up in the Restricted Pages tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to change the avatar in Profile->Picture or any profile information, we are able to update it, although it does not take effect since the picture it is the same generic one and the information fields did not get updated as it should.
h3. Environment
Cloud Confluence 1000.328.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the profile of a user with Atlassian account active on the instance
# Try to change the profile picture by uploading a new one or update any profile information.
# It will upload/update although it will not replicate on the instance.

h3. Expected Results
The picture and profile information must change in all places where we can see the user info
h3. Actual Results
The picture/information are not updated in the Cloud instance
 
h3.Workaround
Disable the Single Sign-on option within User Management
fields.summary: Avatar and profile information not changing in Confluence with Atlassian Account
Wrong Media API Url for Media Picker preventing Confluence Space Imports

h3. Summary
JIRA Issue Macros (to JIRA in same instance) is broken with the following error:
{code:java}The JIRA server returned a trusted apps error: BAD_REMOTE_IP; Request not allowed from IP address:{0}; ["165.254.226.152"]{code}
(note: The IP may be different)

Restarting Confluence resolves the problem, but it may return. 

h3. Environment
Affected version: {{1000.444.5}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This happens randomly:
 # Access page with JIRA Macro

h3. Expected Results
Link to issue appears

h3. Actual Results
This error appears instead:
{code:java}The JIRA server returned a trusted apps error: BAD_REMOTE_IP; Request not allowed from IP address:{0}; ["165.254.226.152"]{code}
 
h3.Workaround
Restart Confluence may work on some situations
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macros report BAD_REMOTE_IP

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using "save as" when editing a Gliffy diagram in a page in Confluence, you lost your previously work.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 1000.322.0 - Prod
* Confluence 1000.268.0 - Dev

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new page in Confluence. Write some text and insert a Gliffy diagram.
2. Save page
3. Click Edit in the newly created page.
4. Add more text or remove text in on the page. Don't save.
5. Click Edit on the Gliffy diagram on the page.
6. Without making any changes to the diagram select File -> Save as.
7. In the radio buttons select Save to: "this page"

h3. Expected Results
The edited diagram saved to the page with all changes.

h3. Screenshots:

#  !Step 1.png|thumbnail! 

#  !Step 3.png|thumbnail! 

#  !Final Steps.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The diagram is saved to the edited page (as expected) but non of the unsaved changes on the page.

h3. Notes
-

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Lost work when using "save as" when editing a Gliffy diagram

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Two dimensional gadget does not load in Confluence when query used is too complex.
When this gadget is used in a Confluence application and the query used on it is too complex (retrieves too much data and make several comparisons) the gadget does not render in Confluence and it keeps loading forever.
Generating a HAR file shows that the gadget fails to retrieve data from JIRA.

h3. Environment
The Two dimensional gadget is a JIRA gadget and have to be imported in Confluence 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup the gadget feed in Confluence to retrieve the Two dimensional gadget from JIRA.
# create a JIRA filter with a complex query on it.
# Use this filter in the Two dimensional gadget in Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget would be displayed normally in Confluence, the same way it's in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results
The gadget does not load and keeps trying to retrieve data endlessly. 
Verified through a HAR file.
 
h3. Notes
Sometimes it can only be reproduced under high Confluence usage.

h3.Workaround
The only possible workaround is to change the query so the data retrieved have reduced complexity.
fields.summary: Two dimensional gadget does not load in Confluence when query used is too complex

fields.description:

 # View a page as anon user on a space where anon users don't have permission to comment.

Comment textarea is not visible.

Certain JIRA Gadgets are not editable anymore in Confluence. The edit option are not available when trying to configure the gadget which is preventing the gadget from being inserted on a page.
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-15 at 09.50.09.png|thumbnail!

(i) Please refer to CONF-45112 for updates on a fix for this symptom.
h3. Summary (of symptom #2)

Existing JIRA gadgets are displayed properly but return the following error when viewed in the editor:
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-15 at 09.50.22.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page with an existing JIRA gadget on it.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget can be edited properly.
h3. Actual Results

Instead of the gadget, the following error message is returned:
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-15 at 09.50.22.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No workaround for now.
fields.summary: Some JIRA gadgets are not editable in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When setting the profile language settings to French, the chart macro is no longer displayed because of the ucirc character in the month of August in French (written _Août_). This was working properly before December 8th.
The issue is also occurring with Swedish special charaters: Å, Ä, Ö.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with tables with 13 column and 1 row with headers with data populated and ensure that at least 1 ucirc character is included in the page.
# Create another new page with chart macro
# Include the page created in step 1 within the chart macro
# Save the page


h3. Expected Results
The chart should display properly on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The following error message is displayed instead of the chart: _org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 1 of document : The entity "ucirc" was referenced, but not declared. Nested exception: The entity "ucirc" was referenced, but not declared._
 
h3. Notes
This was working properly before December 8th which is why this bug ticket was created even though https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-42649 already reported the problem.

h3.Workaround
Set the language settings to English and the chart will display again.
Replacing Swedish special characters allow to display the chart again.
fields.summary: Special characters (ucirc, ouml, Å, Ä, Ö) causing chart macro fail to render

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: Dec 22, 2016 - 01:30 UTC|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
h5. The fix for the problem that caused the incident was released to all sites.
We found sites where the add-on has been installed in the last few days that are affected by different problems.
We are still working towards fixing these sites and will keep reporting updates on this bug report.
{panel}
h3. Summary

Connect add-on such as Gliffy, Balsamiq mockups or Bobswift macros are failing to load with an Unauthorised message. This is not an exhaustive list, some add-on symptoms may include:

Gliffy diagrams don't display on any page.
 Balsamiq mockups display in grey and not load.
 Bobswift add-ons show a loading message: {{Add-on <add-on name> is not responding. Wait or cancel?}}
 401 error message is shown when trying to edit some of the macros or visible in the browser console.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud v1000.690.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a page with a Gliffy diagram. (can be found by searching for: " macroName: gliffy* " )

h3. Expected Results

The Gliffy diagram is displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The diagram is not displayed. The page renders correctly but where the diagram is located, it's blank, no errors are shown on screen.

Browser Console and Network tabs of the Development Tools show 401 (Unauthorized) for
{noformat}
https://confluence-connect.gliffy.net/macro/render?space=XX&container=98566170&....
{noformat}
similar behaviour for other Atlassian Connect add-ons.
h3. Updates:

The fix was applied to all sites but there are some sites still experiencing problems.
 * If an add-on was installed during the last 4 days it is possible that the installation will still be broken. We are taking actions to solve this scenario as well.
 * There is also a handful of sites with add-on configurations that will need to be manually fixed and Atlassian is contacting the plugin vendors to solve that situation.
fields.summary: Confluence add-ons are not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Parent Link displaying invalid content when using JIRA Issue Macro.

 !235077.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create any software project.
# Create one Epic.
# Create one Bug.
# Add the parent link field to the edit/view issue screen for both issue types.
# GG > Hierarchy levels
#* You must have Portfolio for JIRA in order to find Hierarchy levels.
#* Add the Level name Bug and map the issue type Bug.
#* Add the Level name Epic and map the issue type Epic.
#* Make sure that they won't be the first level or it won't work.
# Edit the Epic and set the new Bug as the parent link.
# Create a confluence space.
# Create a new page.
# Add a new issue JIRA filter.
#* Add a query to show the Epic.
#* In Columns to display, select Parent Link.
#* Save the macro.

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA Issue Macro should display the Parent link.

h3. Actual Results

The JIRA Issue Macro is displaying an invalid content.

h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Parent Link displaying invalid content when using JIRA Issue Macro.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Macros (such as Create from Template) that are inside the Center or Align macros do not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce (using Decision log)
# Create a decision page within your space
# After that page is created, navigate to the "Decision log" page, within the space
# Edit the Decision log page, and notice that there is a "Create from Template" macro in that page. 
# Add the align macro, and put the create from template macro within that align macro (set align to left). Notice that the "Create Decision" button now turns into an unclickable link

h3. Expected Results
* The Create Decision button should be aligned to the left. And the button should be intact

h3. Actual Results
* The "Create Decision" button now turns into an unclickable link


h3.Workaround
* Move the Create from Template macro out of the align/center macro
fields.summary: Macros within align or center macros are broken

(Optional - If Necessary)

h3. *How to Replicate*
* Create a pdf file name *Test & only*
* Create confluence page and the following sentence (I'm testing only)
* Highlight the word testing only and click insert link > files and upload the file you created in step 1
* Save the page
* Click on testing only to view the file and click download


h3.*Observed Behaviour*
The pdf title is cut to *Test*

h3. *Expected Behaviour*
We able to see the original pdf title

h3. *Workaround*
Change the ampersand to *And*
fields.summary: Pdf title cut to half if it contain Ampersand

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Gliffy diagrams are placed in an *Excerpt* macro, the *Excerpt Include* macro will not display them (infinite spinner shown).
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-29 at 12.16.19.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Place a Gliffy diagrams inside an *excerpt* macro.
# Use the *Excerpt include* macro on another page to display the content of your *excerpt* macro from *Step 1*.

h3. Expected Results
The content from the *excerpt* macro is displayed properly including the Gliffy diagrams.

h3. Actual Results
The Gliffy diagrams are not displayed and the following error message is seen in the console:
{{Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)}}
 
h3. Notes
The Gliffy diagrams are displayed in the *Excerpt include* macro when previewing the macro content and when previewing the page.

h3.Workaround
Add the Gliffy diagram directly on your page and remove it from the *Excerpt* macro otherwise it will continue displaying an infinite spinner on your page.
fields.summary: Gliffy diagrams inside Excerpt macro are not displayed when using the Excerpt include macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Anchor links created using anchor macro open to a new copy of the same page, rather than jumping to the anchor.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.288.*2*
* Confluence iOS App v.1.6.12.23

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new Confluence page, add some headings with text (loremipsum macro is good here) and place anchor macros before them.
# Create a list of links to the anchors.
# Open page in iOS app. 
# Click on anchor link.

h3. Expected Results
* Anchor link jumps to the anchor.

h3. Actual Results
* Clicking the link opens a new page, and does not jump to the anchor.
 
h3.Workaround
Anchor links that were created instead using the Table of Contents macro do work properly.
fields.summary: Anchor links created with anchor macro do not open to macro in iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is some inconsistency between the following docs.

* [Uploading Large files to WebDAV (Obsolete)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Uploading+Large+files+to+WebDAV]
* [Migrate from Confluence Server to Cloud - Step 5. Import the site content into your Confluence Cloud site|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Migrate+from+Confluence+Server+to+Cloud#MigratefromConfluenceServertoCloud-Step5.ImportthesitecontentintoyourConfluenceCloudsite]

According to the former doc, we no longer support WebDAV. However, it seems that WebDAV has still been supported on the latter doc.

h3. Expected Results

The following section should be deleted from [the doc|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Migrate+from+Confluence+Server+to+Cloud#MigratefromConfluenceServertoCloud-Step5.ImportthesitecontentintoyourConfluenceCloudsite].

{quote}
If your backup zip file is larger than 100 megabytes, upload the file to your cloud side via WebDAV. If the zip file is smaller than 100 megabytes, you do not need to use WebDAV to upload data. This measurement is the size of the zip file, not the size of the data files inside it.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results

The above section still exists on [the doc|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Migrate+from+Confluence+Server+to+Cloud#MigratefromConfluenceServertoCloud-Step5.ImportthesitecontentintoyourConfluenceCloudsite].
fields.summary: Documentation about WebDAV

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JIRA Issue Macro can contain a JQL query like: {{fixVersion in ("1.0", "1.1")}}

If the macro is inserted with a query like that, or an existing one is edited, by Firefox or IE11, everything from the first double-quote onwards is removed.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Cloud instance with JIRA and Confluence.
# Create a project in both, create a JIRA issue, then create a Fix Version "1.0" in the JIRA project and add that to the new issue.
# Using Firefox (I tested with the latest 49.0.2) or IE11, Create a page in Confluence, go to Insert > JIRA Issue/Filter
# Type {{fixVersion = "1.0"}} in the search field, insert the macro, then save the page.

h3. Expected results
The JIRA issue macro on the page shows the JIRA issue that was created in Step 2.

h3. Actual results
Confluence says "JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it."

Upon clicking the "View these issues in JIRA" link, the JQL is {{fixVersion =}} and that's it.

h3. Notes
The draft that is saved into the database is being saved wrongly from the outset even before publishing. Running a {{SELECT body FROM bodycontent WHERE contentid = <ID of draft>}} results in this JQL parameter in the storage format:

{code:xml}
<ac:parameter ac:name="jqlQuery">fixVersion = </ac:parameter>
{code}

If you click Edit on the macro before saving, it still shows the full correct JQL search in the UI.

This issue occurs regardless of what the query is, it just needs double-quotes in it somewhere.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro erases JQL containing double-quotes when inserted with Firefox or IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Space Template not saving when you copy a table from another page with an image attachment in it and paste it when creating template. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud: 	1000.340.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the space and choose *Space tools* > *Content Tools* on the sidebar. 
# Choose *Templates* > *Create New Template*.
# Copy/Paste a table from another page with an image attachment in it.
# Try to save the template 

h3. Expected Results
* The template will be created and will appear on the templates list.

h3. Actual Results
* It is not possible to save the Template and it doesn't appear in the template list. 

h3.Workaround
* Create and save a BLANK template (to force the new template to appear in the templates list), then edit the template, copy / paste the table, and save it again. OR Create the template but add the image via the "Insert Files and Images" dialogue instead of via copy / paste.
fields.summary: Space Template not saving

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Unable to save Page properties report if we mention more than one user in *mentioning user* filter.
h2. Step to replicate
 # Create a test page then add a page property macro and label the page 
 # Save the page created in step 1.
 # Create another page then add page properties report macro 
 # Click add filter and add *Mentioning user filter*
 # After adding the mentioning user filter, please add 2 user in that field.
 # Save the macro then save the page
 # After that click edit page and click edit on the page properties report macro.

 
h2. Observed behaviour

!Screen Shot 2016-12-20 at 3.56.32 PM.png|thumbnail!

 
h2. Expected behaviour

The mentioning user filter show the mention user and able to save the macro.

 
h2. Workaround

Only mention one user under the mentioning user filter.

h3. Summary

Pictures within Center macro will not be displayed.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud. Version 1000.403.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add a "Center" Macro
 # Add a "Profile Picture" macro or any attached picture
 # Save the page.

h3. Expected Results

The profile picture macro is rendered.
h3. Actual Results

The picture doesn't appear

 
h3. Workaround

In some cases, you can workaround that with a Section macro and the "Align center" button.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Macros using *Content by label* are breaking in Confluence Cloud when editing them in Firefox and Safari as well as Chrome version 52.0.2743.116 (64-bit) (not on 54.0.2840.71 (64-bit)).
h3. Environment
 * Firefox and Safari latest stable versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a macro that is using *Content by label* and edit it with Firefox or Safari

h3. Expected Results

The macro content is displayed properly with the content filtered using the label provided.
h3. Actual Results

Macro appears broken with the following message displayed _Unable to locate pages for Page Properties Report. Details: CQL string is "(label = ) and macro = details order by lastModified desc", error message is: "Expecting a value for operator '=' after field 'label'"_
h3. Workaround

Edit the macro with the label in Chrome, it will be displayed properly. However, if the page is again edited using Firefox/Safari, it will break again.
fields.summary: Macros using CQL with the label field will break when editing them in Firefox and Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When ticking a checkbox inside a nested task list, the status of the checkbox will not changed from ticked to unticked and vice versa. The modification is applied if you refresh the page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.322.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a checkbox inside a nested task list (2, 4, 6 deep; odd number nested tasks work fine)
# Tick/Untick the checkbox

h3. Expected Results
The checkbox is ticked/unticked accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
The checkbox status does not change. 

h3.Workaround
- If you tick/untick a checkbox and refresh the page, it becomes unticked/ticked.
- Put the checkbox outside a nested list
fields.summary: Checkboxes inside nested task lists do not tick

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pasting a JIRA link during page/blogpost creation does not automatically convert it into a JIRA Issue macro

Pasting it during edit works though (works in edit, not create)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a JIRA issue URL from JIRA
# Hit *Create* in Confluence (you can create a new page or blogpost)
# Paste the link (copied in step 1) into the page (during the page creation)

h3. Expected Results
Once the link is pasted, it will automatically be converted into a JIRA Issues macro

h3. Actual Results
The link stays as a hyperlink, and not a JIRA Issues macro
 

h3.Workaround
2 workarounds:
# Insert a JIRA Issues macro manually into the page during page creation (search for the said issue using the JIRA Issues macro's search feature)
# Create the page without the issue link. Then edit the page, and paste the link
fields.summary: Pasting a JIRA Issue link during page creation does not convert it into a JIRA Issue Macro

Page byline (page navigation bar) in Confluence should be fixed when scrolling. It moves slightly when you start scrolling which makes me believe it should indeed be fixed, but it doesn't occur.

This is a byline:

!byline.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud 1000.518.2 (not currently available as an Affects Version/s.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to page in Confluence
 # Take note of the byline at the top of the page
 # Scroll down, you'll notice the byline becomes hidden while scrolling.

h3. Expected Results

Byline should be fixed
h3. Actual Results

Byline is not fixed.
h3. Notes

I was able to note that Atlassian's internal site was fixed, but the moment I refreshed the page it stopped being fixed. It seems temperamental.
h3. Workaround

No workaround

Configuration web section header display as "CONFIGURATION.NAME"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The following custom CSS styling applied to the sidebar within the *Sidebar, header and footer* under the *Look and feel section* used to work on Confluence Cloud.
However, it doesn't work anymore on newer versions of Confluence.

{code:none}
{style:import=https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/2129971/sidebar.css?api=v2}
{code}


h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.690.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1: Upload a CSS file {{sidebar.css}} to an arbitrary page.
# Step 2: Go to *Look and feel section* > *Sidebar, header and footer* > Submit _Style Macro_ like below.

{code:none}
{style:import=https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/download/attachments/__ID__/sidebar.css?api=v2}
{code}


h3. Expected Results
* The CSS affects on pages

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens on pages.
 
h3. Notes
* CONF-41681 might be related to this problem.
* As written in [Restricted functions in Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/restricted-functions-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html], CSS injection isn't supported on Confluence Cloud. However there is well-known workaround to apply CSS by using _LOOK AND FEEL_ such as [Editing CSSs in Confluence OnDemand|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/99055/answers/3782083].
* Atlassian keeps fixing the bug on this workaround such as CONF-44957.
* This might not be Style Macro import feature's problem but a {{Content-Type}} problem on attachment file. Now attachment file responds with {{text/plain}} header, but it possibly used to respond with {{text/css}}.

{code:none}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Access-Control-Expose-Headers: Accept-Ranges, Content-Encoding, Content-Length, Content-Range
Cache-Control: private
Content-Disposition: inline; filename="sidebar.css"
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Thu, 22 Dec 2016 00:44:14 GMT
Timing-Allow-Origin: *
x-b3-spanid: 830e54d871fb39f0
x-b3-traceid: 830e54d871fb39f0
Content-Length: 738
Connection: keep-alive
{code}


h3.Workaround
* Write down CSS directly but not importing.
fields.summary: Style Macro import feature no longer works in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem

This error was found by our devs in Confluence:
{code:java}889NotFoundError: DOM Exception 8: An attempt was made to reference a Node in a context where it does not exist.{code}
This error is not allowing our customer to mention users in Confluence
 using the [Mentions Service|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/C4L/Cloud+Support+Readiness+-+Mentions+Service+for+Confluence].
h3. Workaround:
 * Update Safari to version 10+
 * Use a different browser
 * Use the link dialog instead of mentions "[" instead of "@"
fields.summary: Mention Macro - Component broken in Safari 9

fields.description:

On random Confluence pages  images are broken. Some users can see the images, while others cannot.
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.328.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add an image to the page and save it
 # Load the page from an affected user.

h3. Expected Results

You see the image on the page.
h3. Actual Results

A broken image icon appears where the image should be.
h3. Workaround

Atlassian Support can implement a workaround. If you would like to have it applied to your instance, submit a case at support.atlassian.com.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to insert a Gliffy diagram on a blog post, the following error message is displayed upon clicking on the *Save* button: _You need to have create attachment permission to create diagrams._
 !Screen Shot 2017-01-13 at 15.54.31.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blog post in Confluence
# Insert a new Gliffy diagram on that blog post.

h3. Expected Results
The Gliffy diagram is inserted properly like on any Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
The Gliffy diagram is not saved and the error message _You need to have create attachment permission to create diagrams._ is thrown on the user interface.
 
h3.Workaround
None. If you try to copy an existing Gliffy diagram to the blog post, the diagram will not display (infinite spinning wheel instead).

Confluence Cloud: 1000.444.5

fields.description:
h3. Summary
All HTTP requests in Cloud have a 60 second timeout. When a Word export runs longer than that, the task keeps running on the background but the generated export file does not returned to the customer. Confluence throws the "Page Unavailable" error to customer.

If another Word export is triggered, Confluence tries to generate it again. Because there is a 30 second retry done automatically by the smart-status timeout page from the client browser that will trigger a new word export automatically. 
This loop of generating new word exports can render Cloud sites unusable on certain situations.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Cloud page with more than 350 JIRA Issue macro
# Export page to Word

h3. Expected Results
Word file is downloadable at the end of the process.

h3. Actual Results
"Page Unavailable" page is showing.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Long running Word exports are not downloadable in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to embed the [Children Display Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Children+Display+Macro] within the Footer of the Pages in a Space however the links to the Child Pages do not navigate. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud 
* Browsers: 
** Chrome Version 54.0.2840.71 (64-bit)
** Safari Version 10.0.1 (12602.2.14.0.7)
** Firefox 49.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go into Space Tools > Look and Feel > Sidebar, header and footer
# Add the following to the Footer:
{code}{align:align=left}
h4. Child Page(s) \\ 
---- 
{children}{align}{code}
# Save changes and navigate to the Space's Home or another Page with Child pages

h3. Expected Results
Child Page Links are clickable and navigate the user to the Page

h3. Actual Results
The Children pages are displayed and are aligned left, however links to child pages do not action when clicked. 
 
h3. Notes
Was not able to reproduce this issue in Confluence Server 5.10.4
This also occurs in the Header and Sidebar

h3.Workaround
Remove the {{children}} macro from within the align formatting
Use the Children Display Macro within body content of the page
fields.summary: Children Macro Links Do Not Work When Nested in an Align

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Roadmap planner not allowing user to edit new lane's label after it has been added.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to any page in Confluence and edit it.
# Add Roadmap Planner macro.
# Click on *Add Lane*.
# Click on the new added lane's label to edit it and click on _pencil_ icon.
# Try to edit the label.

h3. Expected result
The label should be editable.

h3. Current result
Any of the lanes(including existing lanes) is not editable after new lane added.

h3. Workaround
After a new lane is added, click at any white space to release the focus on *Add Label* button. The lanes' label should be editable again after that.
fields.summary: Roadmap planner not allowing user to edit new lane's label

fields.description:
A message displayed in the top on my Confluence Cloud refers to upcoming collaborative functionalities. The translation in French contains several mistakes (either the translator is bad or was tired writing this). For instance "Liser" is not a french word. We should read "lire" instead. Or in the context, "lisez" would be more appropriate. Not "liser.

Complete sentence :
"L'édition collaborative est bientôt disponible! Passer au niveau supérieur en travaillant ensemble en temps réel. Regarder cette vidéo pour découvrir ce qu'on vous réserve, liser la documentation pour en apprendre plus ou activer la dès maintenant si vous ne voulez pas attendre."

We should read :
 "L'édition collaborative est bientôt disponible ! Passez au niveau supérieur en travaillant ensemble en temps réel. Regardez cette vidéo pour découvrir ce qu'on vous réserve, lisez la documentation pour en apprendre plus ou activez-la dès maintenant si vous ne voulez pas attendre."
fields.summary: Rectify translated content in Confluence

fields.description:
If the server response time isn't particularly quick, a user is able to click the restrictions icon several times, creating several instances of the restriction dialog which all contain the data set from when the button was clicked.

If the user changes anything in the topmost dialog they must cancel all the subsequent dialogs with the understanding of what happened or they'll likely be confused.
fields.summary: Restriction dialog can be queued to open multiple times.

Whenever deleting a blank line before a heading, it causes the heading to lose formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a group with the permission of "View" turned off and other permissions turned on, Confluence sometimes deletes my group from the Groups section of the Space Tools. 

h3. Reported Problem

When unmarked the view property, the group is removed.

h3.  Expected behaviour

The group should be able to have all the permissions, even if the VIEW is unchecked.

h3. Workaround.

Add the group with all permissions and restrict the access to pages.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-restrictions-139414.html

Reporter: dferracciolo@automed5.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A LiveSearch macro has set *Content type to include in search* to only Pages. However, when try to press "Enter" or choose *See More Results*, the search results include attachments, blog posts and pages.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Add LiveSearch Macro to a page
# Under *Content type to include in search* option, restrict the results to only Pages
# Save the page and perform live search
# Choose *See More Results*

h3. Expected Result
Confluence Search page is showing only results of pages.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence Search page is showing results of pages, blog posts and attachments.

h3. Workaround
Manually set the content type from the sidebar.
fields.summary: Allow LiveSearch Macro Parameter Reflects in Search Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
When a .png image is resized in Confluence, a small black x box where the image should be is shown. If you click on that box, the image will actually then display. This issue occurs when an image that has been resized on a page. If you go back and put the image to Original that it will display, but if the size is changed (to any size), then the black x shows on the page once saved.

h3. Environment
Cloud - JIRA v1000.847.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a .png image to a page
# Edit and resize it (the x box takes place)
# Put it back to original size (the image is displayed correctly)

h3. Expected Results
The image gets resized and displayed correctly

h3. Actual Results
A x box is shown instead of the image
fields.summary: Images not showing correctly on IE 11 when images are resized

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers are not able to edit pages in their instance. Attempts to do so results in the following errors:

!atlassian_1.png!
 !atlassian_2.png!
h3. Workaround

Disabling Connect add-ons will workaround this issue. To do that, navigate to {{Confluence Administration >> Manage Add-Ons}}, then expand all your User-Installed add-ons. Check whether the addon's version has a *AC* at the back, example:
 !AC.png|width=600!

Incident status at: [http://status.atlassian.com|http://status.atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Pages in Confluence Cloud Due to Connect Add-Ons

fields.description:
h4.Issue

 

When inserting Team Calendar in one of the Confluence pages, and then, try to render it with the Mobile App, the content of the calendar will not be displayed with some specific messages, and also, having its structure not working.

 

h4.Steps to Reproduce

 
 # Go to a page in Confluence, and *Edit*
 # Now, click on *Insert > Team Calendars*
 # **After making sure to insert the calendar, click on *Save*
 # Try to access the page using the *Confluence Mobile App* for Cloud.

 

The following behaviour is noticed:

 

For the warnings:

 

!IMG_7579.PNG|thumbnail! 

 

 For the structure issue:

 

!IMG_7580.PNG|thumbnail!

 

h4.Workaround

 

There's no workaround for the mobile app, at the moment.
fields.summary: Team Calendar not Rendering in Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Space Admins cannot remove page restrictions that were created by a deleted user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few new users in a Cloud instance, for example user -> *Test*, *Test2*, *spaceadminuser*
 # Login as *spaceadminuser* and create a space (this is so the *spaceadminuser* has space admin permission to the space)
 # Login as this new user -> *Test*
 ## Create a page in Confluence and apply view and edit restrictions
 ## grant permission to this restricted page to another user say *Test2*
 # Switch back to your *sysadmin* user and delete user T*est*
 # Login as the *spaceadminuser* (which has *space-admin* permission in the Space with the restricted page)
 # Access Space Tools -> Permission -> Restricted pages and click on the padlock in order to remove the page restrictions for the user *Test*
 # Notice the page redirects to a "Request access" page, instead of removing the permission
 # Go back to Space Tools -> Permission -> Restricted pages and click on the padlock for user *Test2* (this user still exists)
 # All restrictions are removed from the page including the restrictions for the deleted user *Test*

h3. **Expected Results

Clicking the padlock for a deleted user removes the restriction for the deleted user
h3. Actual Results

Clicking the padlock redirects to a request access page. 
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Workaround is to remove the restriction for another user and this causes the deleted user restrictions to be cleaned up.
fields.summary: Cannot remove page restriction when restriction is created by a deleted user

fields.description:
h2. Summary

User unable to enable Bob Swift Atlassian Add-ons - Advanced Tables.

User seeing the following error:
{code:java}The table-plus macro is 'unknown'.{code}

User should be able to use the plugin without any error.

 
h3. Workaround

Restart Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a page with code macro with theme on it, the theme is not shown after exporting to PDF.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.340.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and add code macro.
# Apply a Theme to the code macro (RDark).
# Save the page 
# Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
* The Theme should be shown on the exported page.

h3. Actual Results
* The Theme is not shown on the exported page.
fields.summary: Code macro theme is not shown after exporting to PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The display of an image with small font size text appears blurry or altered when viewing a page. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.904.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Inset > Files 

h3. Expected Results
* Image Display should preserve the quality of images with small font size text.

h3. Actual Results
* Image Display is altered or it's not clear as it should be. 
*  !viewpage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
# Viewing the image through Preview is okay

h3.Workaround
Apply Image Property
# Edit the Page
# Select the Image
# Click the *Properties* Button
# Under *Effects* > Choose *Snapshot*
fields.summary: Images with Small Font Size text appears blurry or altered

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After importing a space from one instance to another, if the *Task List* macro was configured to display the task(s) of a specific page via the field *Space(s) and page(s)*, the *Task List* macro will be empty and the page title will be changed to use the original page id on the source instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space with a *Task List* macro on a page which displays the task(s) of specific pages.
# Import the space from one instance to another.
# Check the *Task List* macro

h3. Expected Results
The *Task List* macro displays the tasks from the page it is supposed to display tasks from.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed in the *Task List* macro and the page titles is changed to the original page ID which do not exist on the destination instance.
 
h3.Workaround
You have to manually update all macros so that the correct pages are linked to the macros.
fields.summary: Task List macro not updated properly after migration

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When searching only with Operator, the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: INVALID_SYNTAX_CANNOT_PARSE: Syntax Error, cannot parse ===:
    at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.mapper.AbstractTextFieldQueryMapper.tryParse(AbstractTextFieldQueryMapper.java:24)

caused by: INVALID_SYNTAX_CANNOT_PARSE: Syntax Error, cannot parse ===:
    at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.flexible.standard.parser.StandardSyntaxParser.generateParseException(StandardSyntaxParser.java:1054) 
{noformat}

h2. Steps to Reproduce the error

On Confluence search column, type in {{===}} and hit enter

h2. Expected Behavior

Confluence searches as text for any title that contains the symbol.

h2. Actual Behavior

Redirected to a page where {{Oops - an error has occurred}} message is seen with the stack trace below:
{noformat}
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: INVALID_SYNTAX_CANNOT_PARSE: Syntax Error, cannot parse ===:
    at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.mapper.AbstractTextFieldQueryMapper.tryParse(AbstractTextFieldQueryMapper.java:24)

caused by: INVALID_SYNTAX_CANNOT_PARSE: Syntax Error, cannot parse ===:
    at org.apache.lucene.queryparser.flexible.standard.parser.StandardSyntaxParser.generateParseException(StandardSyntaxParser.java:1054) 
{noformat}

h2. Additional Information

It also happened to other operations, such as {{AND AND AND}} and similar pattern, sometimes it does not redirect the page, however the error message is similar.
fields.summary: CQL Searching with Operator Throws Error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the JIRA Issue Macro results contain an Epic Link that has '&' and you wanted to display any custom field. The JIRA issue Macro will not show the list of issues on the page

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.907.0
JIRA v1000.718.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert the JIRA Issues macro onto your Confluence page
# Enter the JQL query or filter into the Search box. (Make sure that the JQL Query contains and Epic Link Result that has '&')
# Choose Display options, to display any Custom Field
# Choose Insert

h3. Expected Results
* It should display a list of issues on your page, based on a JIRA Query Language (JQL) search or filter.

h3. Actual Results
* The JIRA issue Macro will not show the list of issues on the page.
{noformat}
Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error
{noformat}
* Confluence Logs will show
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Error on line 892: The entity name must immediately follow the '&' in the entity reference.
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro will not show if the Epic Link contains '&'

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are unable to center align content in a table that has been center aligned

h3. Environment

* Confluence Cloud v.1000.322.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Add a 3x1 table to page
# Press ctrl + a or cmd + a to select all content
# Click on Align Center button in editor to align the table to center of page
# Fill table cells with content
# Widen table columns to see how content aligns left currently
# Highlight the text that has been added to a cell
# Click 'Align Center' button

h3. Expected Results

Content in table cell is centered in the cell

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens

h3.Workaround

Use center macro to center align table. You can then center align contents in cell without issues
fields.summary: Unable to Center Align Content in  Center Aligned Table

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page Properties Report macro is not sortable if it contains JIRA Issues macro such as this:

!Screen Shot 2016-12-21 at 2.02.33 PM.png|width=700px!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with Page Properties macro inserted 
# Create a table within the Page Properties macro, and add a JIRA Issue link to any of the cells
# Create a Page Properties Report macro in another page, make sure the page properties from the page in step 1 is fetched

h3. Expected Results
The page properties report table should still be sortable (even if it's not possible to sort the column containing the JIRA macro)

h3. Actual Results
The sort option disappears completely, for all columns
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro is not sortable if it contains JIRA Issues
